newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey sells 109.8 trln lira inflation-index bonds. [CORRECTED 15:46 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Turkey sells 109.8 trln lira inflation-index bonds. [CORRECTED 15:46 GMT]

text.p: (Central bank corrects amount to 109.8 trln lira from 110.8 trln lira)

Turkey sold 109.8 trillion lira of inflation-indexed, two-year bonds at 24 percent risk premium on Tuesday, compared to 18.6 trillion lira sale and 25 percent risk premium in the first inflation-indexed, two-year bond auction on March 4.
There will be three-month coupon (interest) payments on the bonds.
Banks will pay 108.7 trillion lira to the Treasury for the auction on Wednesday when they will collect 68 trillion lira from the central bank for maturing reverse repo repayments.
